text: Alyson Leigh Rosenfeld (born March 21, 1987) is an American voice actress, singer, writer and producer best known for voicing Bonnie, Nurse Joy, and Sophocles on Pokémon and Rio on Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal. == Filmography == ===Animation=== * Pokémon (TV franchise shows/movies) – Nurse Joy **Pokémon – Sophocles, Bonnie, Roxie, Nurse Joy, Nurse Joy's Audino, Clemont's Bunnelby, Mallow's Bounsweet/Steenee/Tsareena ** Pokémon the Movie: Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel - Bonnie ** Pokémon the Movie: Hoopa and the Clash of Ages - Bonnie ** Pokémon the Movie: Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction – Bonnie ** Pokémon the Movie: Genesect and the Legend Awakened – Nurse Joy, Nurse Joy's Audino ** Pokémon the Movie: Kyurem vs. the Sword of Justice – Nurse Joy, Nurse Joy's Audino ** Pokémon: Zoroark: Master of Illusions - Peg * Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Gates to Infinity (video game) – Pikachu * PokéPark 2: Wonders Beyond (video game) – Audino * Super 4 – Princess Leonora and Baba Carra and Fairy Queen * Yu-Gi-Oh! (series) ** ZEXAL II – Rio/Marin, Iris ** ARC-V – Allie, Riley Akaba, Amanda, Grace and Gloria Tyler ** VRAINS – Queen * Axel: The Biggest Little Hero – Second Guardian * Winx Club (DuArt Film and Video, season 7) – Miele *Winx Club (DuArt Film and Video, season 8-present) - Musa (replaces Kate Bristol) * World of Winx (Netflix)- Evans, Madelyn * Sheep and Wolves - Shia * Suzy's Zoo - Witzy * Psychic School Wars - Kahori Harukawa * Regal Academy - Joy LeFrog * Robocar Poli - Cleany * Mobile Suit Gundam: The Origin - Fraw Bow * P. King Duckling - OC Actress * Tip The Mouse - Tip The Mouse (Voice) * Nella the Princess Knight - Olivia * Yu-Gi-Oh!: The Dark Side of Dimensions - Little Girl / School Girl / Tourist Woman * Your Name - Sakura / Weather Woman * Alisa Knows What to Do! * Birdboy: The Forgotten Children - Psychopaths * The Stolen Princess - Princess Mila (English Dub) * Lu Over The Wall - Isaki (English Dub) * Strawberry Shortcake - Strawberry Shortcake * Polly Pocket - Polly Pocket * Lastman - Siri (English Dub) * Sound! Euphonium - Hazuki Katou (English Dub) * The Snow Queen 3: Fire and Ice - Troll Kids (English Dub) * The Snow Queen 4: Mirrorlands - Lillith (English Dub) * Mazinger Z: Infinity - Sayaka Yumi (English Dub) *Promare - Aina Ardebit (English Dub) * 44 Cats - Neko, Lola, Fleur, Zoe * Snack World - Pluglet, Penne, Shee, Honeybun, Nutmegg Spicy ===Live action=== * Crumbly Kitchen – Liz Berger * An Addiction to Payne – Annie * Parker & Steve – Gabby * Byte Me – Leslie Schwartz ===Video Games=== * Pathfinder: Kingmaker – Octavia * PokéPark2 – Audino * White Day: A Labyrinth Named School – Bathroom Ghost, Chalkboard Ghost * Smite – Lady Liberty Nox * Modern Combat Versus – Mi-Nu ===Web shorts=== * Polly Pocket WildBrain Spark shorts - Polly Pocket == Theatre == Rosenfeld starred as Princess Winnifred in Mary Rodgers' Once Upon a Mattress from February 22nd - March 17th, 2019. From January 27 - February 18, 2018, Rosenfeld performed in William Finn's A New Brain as Rhoda. From January 28 - February 19, 2017, Rosenfeld starred in Stephen Sondheim's Marry Me a Little and as Lucy in You're A Good Man, Charlie Brown. Both shows were performed in rep. Rosenfeld starred as Gertrude in Lynn Ahrens & Stephen Flaherty's Seussical at The Gallery Players from January 29 until February 21, 2016. Rosenfeld starred as the titular role in Stephen Schwartz's first professional NYC production of The Baker's Wife at The Gallery Players, March 7–29, 2015. == Personal life == On October 20, 2017, Rosenfeld married James Weaver Clark. In October 2019, Rosenfeld announced she was expecting her first child, and on April 28, 2020, she announced the birth of her son, Frederick Leo Clark. == Production credits == === Writer === * Crumbly Kitchen === Producer === * Crumbly Kitchen * Parker & Steve == References == # Behind The Voice Actor # IMDB birthdate verification == External links == * * * * Alyson Leigh Rosenfeld on Behind The Voice Actors Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Actresses from New York City Category:American film actresses Category:American stage actresses Category:American television actresses Category:American voice actresses Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Tisch School of the Arts alumni Category:21st-century American actresses Category:21st-century American singers Category:21st- century American women singers
title: Alyson Leigh Rosenfeld
